description.narrative: FL §06.32.08.80 Global Framework for Integrated Stabilisation Efforts (development assistance)

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative:
Psychosocial Support
Civil Society Organization is selected, trained, conducts needs assessment and delivers PSS in vulnerable communities.
- Activities and sessions with the target groups will be documented - Pre and post activity surveys will be conducted - Pre and post surveys will be used as a tool to change and to further tailor make community-based PSS sessions to the target groups and their specific needs.

comment.narrative: 0% of targeted land and infrastructure of socio-economic value has been cleared of explosive remnants of war and put back into use. 0% of children, youth and adults in targeted vulnerable communities have received explosive ordnance risk education and reported increased knowledge and sense of safety. 0% of children in targeted vulnerable communities have received psychosocial support and report increased wellbeing

title.narrative:
ERW Clearance Male and Female Survey and Clearance team is recruited, trained and accredited by the Libyan Mine Action Centre to dispose of ERW in priority areas under Task Orders from the national authorities.
- Members of survey and clearance team are all accredited and accreditation certified by the Libyan Mine Action Centre. - IMSMA reporting to the Libyan Mine Action Centre will be the indicator for results of EOD call-outs, unexploded ordnance destroyed and m2 of land and infra structure returned to socio-economic use.

comment.narrative: 0% of targeted land and infrastructure of socio-economic value has been cleared of explosive remnants of war and put back into use. 0% of children, youth and adults in targeted vulnerable communities have received explosive ordnance risk education and reported increased knowledge and sense of safety. 0% of children in targeted vulnerable communities have received psychosocial support and report increased wellbeing

title.narrative:
Risk Education Risk Education team is recruited and trained, then accredited by the Libya Mine Action Centre to deliver risk awareness sessions to targeted beneficiaries under Task Orders from the national authorities.
- Members of the Risk Education team are all accredited and accreditation certified by the Libyan Mine Action Centre. - No. of Risk Education sessions conducted will be recorded - Risk Education sessions, Pre and post surveys will be conducted - Pre and post surveys will be used as a tool to change and tailor make RE sessions to the specific needs of the target group

comment.narrative: 0% of targeted land and infrastructure of socio-economic value has been cleared of explosive remnants of war and put back into use. 0% of children, youth and adults in targeted vulnerable communities have received explosive ordnance risk education and reported increased knowledge and sense of safety. 0% of children in targeted vulnerable communities have received psychosocial support and report increased wellbeing

title.narrative:
Land and infrastructure cleared of ERW is taken-up for socio-economic use.
OI.1a. Positive feedback from beneficiaries on DCA performance OI.1b. Quality Assurance (QA) assessments by DCA & Libyan Mine Action Centre OI.1c. Post-clearance impact surveys evidence increased socio-economic land use.

comment.narrative: At the start of the project, a baseline will be conducted with relevance to outcome 1, 2 and 3. The baseline will be used as the basis for measuring impact at end of project.

title.narrative:
Safety (and the adoption of safe behaviour) of the citizens of vulnerable communities is greatly increased through knowledge of dangers of mines and ERW.
OI.2. Mine Action Centre RE Forms show number of sessions held OI.2b. Mine Action Centre records show reduction in ERW related accidents OI.2c. Pre and Post RE session reports show increased knowledge

comment.narrative: At the start of the project, a baseline will be conducted with relevance to outcome 1, 2 and 3. The baseline will be used as the basis for measuring impact at end of project.

title.narrative:
The wellbeing of children in vulnerable communities is increased through Community Based Psychosocial Support.
M&E in vulnerable communities record increased wellbeing amongst children

comment.narrative: At the start of the project, a baseline will be conducted with relevance to outcome 1, 2 and 3. The baseline will be used as the basis for measuring impact at end of project.
